author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
A rift in gold and purse we spy,
Not born of market's hearty cry,
'Tis deficit, the hound unleashed,
Into economy, it's not reached. 

Upon the Man of Fire's stead,
Rain did fall, a river's bed.
Snails and tortoises find glee,
While men in mud are stuck, not free.

Alas, the minstrel of the tide,
In his own Margaritaville, he died.
Sings a beach-bound goat no more,
Silenced, hustle, and salty lore.

feedItems.title: Do Higher Deficits Cause Inflation? Not This Year
feedItems.description: The gap between federal spending and revenue is widening, but not for reasons that stimulate the economy.

feedItems.title: Heavy Rain Leaves Burning Man Stuck in Mud
feedItems.description: An overnight storm dropped nearly an inch of rain on the arid desert where Burning Man is taking place, prompting organizers to close the gates to traffic and order tens of thousands of participants to shelter in place.

feedItems.title: Jimmy Buffett, 'Margaritaville' Singer and Beach-Themed Businessman, Dies
feedItems.description: The crooner sang about beach bums, hustlers and pirates while heading up numerous business ventures.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Pray, ponder on thy golden age, of Roth and 401K,
Save but for the morrow's stage, in schemes that promise pay,
For many a firm hath added these, retirement's solid pillars,
Yet tricky seems the number's ease, that fills the trader's tillers.

Lo, a wildcard makes them tremble, Wall Street to White House,
His actions they can but assemble, in nervous thought they douse,
Though unpredictable his current, danger seems apparent,
In stocks and shares with one errant, the consequence is rampant.

To the moon and back we've heard, a moonshot without peer,
Around the world, each whispered word, a feat that caused great cheer,
Yet in bracing for the familiar, the known path tread before,
It seems that nothing is similar, to the unpredictable lore.

feedItems.title: Roth vs. Traditional 401(k): Where to Put Your Money for Retirement?
feedItems.description: Thousands of companies have added Roth 401(k)s to their retirement plans. Getting the math right is proving tricky.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: He's a total wildcard—and he's making Wall Street and the White House nervous

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: The moonshot heard round the world

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon the Morrow's dawn, a noble heart ends its beat,
Richardson of New Mexico, his life's song now complete.
In a world beyond ours, perhaps he finds his seat,
As Paladin of politics, his legacy replete.

Inlining null and void, the minstrel of the summer tide,
Jimmy Buffett sails beyond, where the celestial bodies abided.
May he, in paradise, find his cheeseburger aside,
In realms ethereal, where heart's desire reside.

A judgement fair, erases a conviction thought just,
Fox's former lieutenant, in whom was placed trust.
A song of bribes he once hummed, in a game of lust,
Now United in a dance, under law's fair st. dust.

feedItems.title: Bill Richardson, Former New Mexico Governor and U.N. Ambassador, Dies at 75
feedItems.description: The Democrat also served as energy secretary for Bill Clinton and had aspired to be the country’s first Hispanic president.

feedItems.title: Jimmy Buffett Departs With the Summer
feedItems.description: He understood our longings. May he find a cheeseburger in paradise, medium rare with Muenster’d be nice.

feedItems.title: Judge Tosses Conviction of Former Fox Executive in FIFA Bribery Case
feedItems.description: Hernan Lopez had been found guilty of bribing soccer officials to secure broadcasting rights to World Cup-related matches.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Beware, yon merchant! Bet not on leveraged ETF,
In Odin's shadow, the runes of risk are deft.
"Most worthy", sayeth the wise, "is the cost borne in jest",
Yet the serpent's bite in investments lies deep, unconfessed.

Speak now, o skald, of dwellings rich and fancy-free,
In the shiny bosom of America, does the golden manor plea.
One hundred million tokens for a hall, do mine ears deceive?
The giants of Midgard's market do weave an intricate weave.

Hearken now to the tale of Fitbits and Watches, forged in Apple's den,
By the hands of tireless dwarves, brought to the homes of men.
Prove they do a worthy charm, wished health to family clans,
Yet hold fast to this wisdom: long-lasting habit demands.

feedItems.title: Are Leveraged ETFs Worth the Costs and Risk?
feedItems.description: For most fund categories, the answer is yes, according to new research.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: One of America's most exclusive enclaves could be about to get its first $100 million home

feedItems.title: Fitbits, Apple Watches Do Make You Healthier, Say Studies
feedItems.description: Families that track their physical activity together move more, but making habits stick is a challenge.
